context: The word 'lõpeb' is the 3rd person singular present form of the Estonian verb 'lõpema', which means 'to end' or 'to finish'. It describes something that is currently coming to an end in the present tense. In the dictionary definition provided, it appears in the phrase 'mis lõpeb doktoritöö kaitsmisega', meaning 'which ends with the defense of a doctoral thesis', indicating completion of doctoral studies.
